docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs ¤ For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands ¤ mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout ¤ mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Overview

The format is based on Keep a Changelog and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning . v0.1.0 - 2022-05-12 ¤ Compare with v0.0.24 Added ¤ Add document link ( 1aae6eb by MarkHallett). v0.0.24 - 2020-06-23 ¤ Compare with first commit Added ¤ Add manifest.in ( 155fc6e by MarkHallett). docs.text: Be nice! ¤
docs.title: Code of Conduct

docs.text: All welcome !!! example "Example: setup Django before collecting documentation" yaml # mkdocs.yml plugins: - mkdocstrings: handlers: python: setup_commands: - import os - import django - os.environ.setdefault("DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE", "my_django_app.settings") - django.setup() !!! important Additional options like setup_commands are used only once, when instantiating the handler the first time it is requested. This is why they are considered global-only options, as they will have no effect if used as local options.

docs.text: module doc string in .../mhlib/ init .py eg ¤ eg lib code Example imports of EG_VAR, import mhlib, print (mhlib.eg.EG_VAR) import mhlib.eg as eg, print (eg.EG_VAR) from mhlib import eg, print (eg.EG_VAR) from mhlib.eg import EG_VAR as eg_var, print (eg_var) MhEg ¤ eg class doc string Source code in mhlib/eg.py class MhEg ( object ): ''' eg class doc string ''' def runMhEg ( self ): ''' doc string for member function ''' return 10 def slow ( self ): t = 3 time . sleep ( t ) return def call_external_func ( self ): x = l2 . L2Mh () y = x . slow () return y runMhEg ( self ) ¤ doc string for member function Source code in mhlib/eg.py def runMhEg ( self ): ''' doc string for member function ''' return 10 test () ¤ returns a test string Source code in mhlib/eg.py def test (): ''' returns a test string ''' return 'ok' l2 special ¤ l2 ¤ l2 code L2Test () ¤ returns a test string Source code in mhlib/l2/l2.py def L2Test (): ''' returns a test string ''' return 'ok'
docs.title: mhlib

docs.text: eg lib code Example imports of EG_VAR, import mhlib, print (mhlib.eg.EG_VAR) import mhlib.eg as eg, print (eg.EG_VAR) from mhlib import eg, print (eg.EG_VAR) from mhlib.eg import EG_VAR as eg_var, print (eg_var)

docs.text: eg class doc string Source code in mhlib/eg.py class MhEg ( object ): ''' eg class doc string ''' def runMhEg ( self ): ''' doc string for member function ''' return 10 def slow ( self ): t = 3 time . sleep ( t ) return def call_external_func ( self ): x = l2 . L2Mh () y = x . slow () return y

docs.text: .md-content { max-width: none !important; } article h1, article > a { display: none; } var coviframe = document.getElementById("coviframe"); function resizeIframe() { coviframe.style.height = coviframe.contentWindow.document.documentElement.offsetHeight + 'px'; } coviframe.contentWindow.document.body.onclick = function() { coviframe.contentWindow.location.reload(); }
